intro: Pimelea pilibunda, commonly known as the narrow-leafed candlebush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, preferring well-drained soils. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with a compact, upright growth habit. Pimelea pilibunda is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
